text: Bettina Gilois (July 9, 1961July 5, 2020) was a German-American screenwriter and author. She was known for her work on the HBO movie Bessie, and Disney's Glory Road and McFarland, USA. Gilois won an Emmy Nomination for Outstanding Writing of a Television Movie and a Black Reel Awards of 2016 nomination for Bessie. She was born in Berlin. Gilois was an associate professor in the Lawrence and Kristina Dodge College of Film and Media Arts at Chapman University. Gilois died on July 5, 2020 from cancer in California, aged 58. ==References== Category:1961 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in California Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:German screenwriters Category:Screenwriters from California Category:Writers from Berlin
